questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important key performance indicator (KPI) to monitor the effectiveness of disaster recovery processes?

choices.A: Percentage of issues arising from the disaster recovery test resolved on time
choices.C: Percentage of IT systems recovered within the mean time to restore (MTTR) during the disaster recovery test
choices.B: Percentage of IT systems included in the disaster recovery test scope
choices.D: Percentage of IT systems meeting the recovery time objective (RTO) during the disaster recovery test

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST enables an organization to develop a comprehensive key performance indicator (KPI) strategy to measure all key controls?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Agree with B.

choices.D: Ensure controls have their own KPIs.
choices.B: Align control performance goals to KPIs.
choices.C: Minimize the number of lagging performance indicators.
choices.A: Use KPIs that can be financially quantified.

questions.question_text: An organization has outsourced its accounts payable function to an external service provider that does not have an effective business continuity pian (BCP) in place. Who owns the associated risk?

discussion.content: I also believe is "C" as outsourcing does not transfer the risk or consequences of a materialized risk.
I think this should be 'C' as you can't outsource accountability

Selected Answer: C
Agree with C. The risk still sits with the business doing the outsourcing.

Selected Answer: C
C. Business process owner, Accountability is not outsourced

Selected Answer: C
The organization that has outsourced its accounts payable function to the external service provider owns the associated risk. It is the responsibility of the organization to ensure that the external service provider has effective business continuity plans (BCP) in place to manage the risk associated with outsourcing the function.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would BEST enable senior management to make informed decisions about the effectiveness of existing controls to mitigate risk?

choices.A: Quantitative analysis of total control cost in monetary terms
choices.D: Qualitative measurement of the impact on business operations should a risk event occur
choices.B: Quantitative measurement of the controls' ability to reduce the likelihood of risk events occurring
choices.C: Qualitative assessment of control effectiveness by surveying control owners

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B, I believe.
